AIPackage.name: AIPackage
AIPackage.summary: Specifies an AI package and its associated information.

options.name: serious
options.summary: The highest level of risk posed by an AI system.

options.name: high
options.summary: The second-highest level of risk posed by an AI system.

options.name: medium
options.summary: The third-highest level of risk posed by an AI system.

options.name: low
options.summary: Low/no risk is posed by an AI system.

EnergyConsumption.name: EnergyConsumption
EnergyConsumption.summary: The class that contains properties to describe energy consumption incurred by an AI model in different stages of its lifecycle.

EnergyUnitType.name: EnergyUnitType
EnergyUnitType.summary: Specifies the unit of energy consumption.

options.name: kilowattHour
options.summary: Kilowatt-hour.

options.name: megajoule
options.summary: Megajoule.

options.name: other
options.summary: Any other units of energy measurement.

EnergyConsumptionDescription.name: EnergyConsumptionDescription
EnergyConsumptionDescription.summary:
The class that helps note down the quantity of energy consumption and the unit
used for measurement.

Package.name: Package
Package.summary: Refers to any unit of content that can be associated with a distribution of software.

Sbom.name: Sbom
Sbom.summary: A collection of SPDX Elements describing a single package.

SbomType.name: SbomType
SbomType.summary: Provides a set of values to be used to describe the common types of SBOMs that tools may create.

options.name: design
options.summary: SBOM of intended, planned software project or product with included components (some of which may not yet exist) for a new software artifact.

options.name: source
options.summary: SBOM created directly from the development environment, source files, and included dependencies used to build an product artifact.

options.name: build
options.summary: SBOM generated as part of the process of building the software to create a releasable artifact (e.g., executable or package) from data such as source files, dependencies, built components, build process ephemeral data, and other SBOMs.

options.name: deployed
options.summary: SBOM provides an inventory of software that is present on a system. This may be an assembly of other SBOMs that combines analysis of configuration options, and examination of execution behavior in a (potentially simulated) deployment environment.

options.name: runtime
options.summary: SBOM generated through instrumenting the system running the software, to capture only components present in the system, as well as external call-outs or dynamically loaded components. In some contexts, this may also be referred to as an “Instrumented” or “Dynamic” SBOM.

options.name: analyzed
options.summary: SBOM generated through analysis of artifacts (e.g., executables, packages, containers, and virtual machine images) after its build. Such analysis generally requires a variety of heuristics. In some contexts, this may also be referred to as a “3rd party” SBOM.

Snippet.name: Snippet
Snippet.summary: Describes a certain part of a file.

SoftwareArtifact.name: SoftwareArtifact
SoftwareArtifact.summary: A distinct article or unit related to Software.

File.name: File
File.summary: Refers to any object that stores content on a computer.

ContentIdentifierType.name: ContentIdentifierType
ContentIdentifierType.summary: Specifies the type of a content identifier.

options.name: gitoid
options.summary: Gitoid stands for [Git Object ID](https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Git-Internals-Git-Objects) and a gitoid of type blob is a unique hash of a binary artifact. A gitoid may represent the software [Artifact ID](https://github.com/omnibor/spec/blob/main/spec/SPEC.md#artifact-id) or the [OmniBOR Identifier](https://github.com/omnibor/spec/blob/main/spec/SPEC.md#omnibor-identifier) for the software artifact's associated [OmniBOR Document](https://github.com/omnibor/spec/blob/main/spec/SPEC.md#omnibor-document).

options.name: swhid
options.summary: SoftWare Hash IDentifier, persistent intrinsic identifiers for digital artifacts. The syntax of the identifiers is defined in the [SWHID specification](https://www.swhid.org/specification/v1.1/4.Syntax) and in the case of filess they typically look like `swh:1:cnt:94a9ed024d3859793618152ea559a168bbcbb5e2`.

FileKindType.name: FileKindType
FileKindType.summary: Enumeration of the different kinds of SPDX file.

options.name: directory
options.summary: The file represents a directory and all content stored in that directory.

options.name: file
options.summary: The file represents a single file (default).

SoftwarePurpose.name: SoftwarePurpose
SoftwarePurpose.summary: Provides information about the primary purpose of an Element.

options.name: application
options.summary: the Element is a software application

options.name: archive
options.summary: the Element is an archived collection of one or more files (.tar, .zip, etc)

options.name: bom
options.summary: Element is a bill of materials

options.name: configuration
options.summary: Element is configuration data

options.name: container
options.summary: the Element is a container image which can be used by a container runtime application

options.name: data
options.summary: Element is data

options.name: device
options.summary: the Element refers to a chipset, processor, or electronic board

options.name: deviceDriver
options.summary: Element represents software that controls hardware devices

options.name: diskImage
options.summary: the Element refers to a disk image that can be written to a disk, booted in a VM, etc. A disk image typically contains most or all of the components necessary to boot, such as bootloaders, kernels, firmware, userspace, etc.

options.name: documentation
options.summary: Element is documentation

options.name: evidence
options.summary: the Element is the evidence that a specification or requirement has been fulfilled

options.name: executable
options.summary: Element is an Artifact that can be run on a computer

options.name: file
options.summary: the Element is a single file which can be independently distributed (configuration file, statically linked binary, Kubernetes deployment, etc)

options.name: filesystemImage
options.summary: the Element is a file system image that can be written to a disk (or virtual) partition

options.name: firmware
options.summary: the Element provides low level control over a device's hardware

options.name: framework
options.summary: the Element is a software framework

options.name: install
options.summary: the Element is used to install software on disk

options.name: library
options.summary: the Element is a software library

options.name: manifest
options.summary: the Element is a software manifest

options.name: model
options.summary: the Element is a machine learning or artificial intelligence model

options.name: module
options.summary: the Element is a module of a piece of software

options.name: operatingSystem
options.summary: the Element is an operating system

options.name: other
options.summary: the Element doesn't fit into any of the other categories

options.name: patch
options.summary: Element contains a set of changes to update, fix, or improve another Element

options.name: platform
options.summary: Element represents a runtime environment

options.name: requirement
options.summary: the Element provides a requirement needed as input for another Element

options.name: source
options.summary: the Element is a single or a collection of source files

options.name: specification
options.summary: the Element is a plan, guideline or strategy how to create, perform or analyse an application

options.name: test
options.summary: The Element is a test used to verify functionality on an software element

DictionaryEntry.name: DictionaryEntry
DictionaryEntry.summary: A key with an associated value.

options.name: yes
options.summary: Indicates presence of the field.

options.name: no
options.summary: Indicates absence of the field.

options.name: noAssertion
options.summary: Makes no assertion about the field.

Element.name: Element
Element.summary: Base domain class from which all other SPDX-3.0 domain classes derive.

Hash.name: Hash
Hash.summary: A mathematically calculated representation of a grouping of data.

Annotation.name: Annotation
Annotation.summary: An assertion made in relation to one or more elements.

AnnotationType.name: AnnotationType
AnnotationType.summary: Specifies the type of an annotation.

options.name: other
options.summary: Used to store extra information about an Element which is not part of a Review (e.g. extra information provided during the creation of the Element).

options.name: review
options.summary: Used when someone reviews the Element.

LifecycleScopedRelationship.name: LifecycleScopedRelationship
LifecycleScopedRelationship.summary: Provide context for a relationship that occurs in the lifecycle.

Relationship.name: Relationship
Relationship.summary: Describes a relationship between one or more elements.

LifecycleScopeType.name: LifecycleScopeType
LifecycleScopeType.summary: Provide an enumerated set of lifecycle phases that can provide context to relationships.

options.name: design
options.summary: A relationship has specific context implications during an element's design.

options.name: development
options.summary: A relationship has specific context implications during development phase of an element.

options.name: build
options.summary: A relationship has specific context implications during an element's build phase, during development.

options.name: test
options.summary: A relationship has specific context implications during an element's testing phase, during development.

options.name: runtime
options.summary: A relationship has specific context implications during the execution phase of an element.

options.name: other
options.summary: A relationship has other specific context information necessary to capture that the above set of enumerations does not handle.

Organization.name: Organization
Organization.summary: A group of people who work together in an organized way for a shared purpose.

Agent.name: Agent
Agent.summary: Agent represents anything with the potential to act on a system.

PackageVerificationCode.name: PackageVerificationCode
PackageVerificationCode.summary: An SPDX version 2.X compatible verification method for software packages.

IntegrityMethod.name: IntegrityMethod
IntegrityMethod.summary: Provides an independently reproducible mechanism that permits verification of a specific Element.

HashAlgorithm.name: HashAlgorithm
HashAlgorithm.summary: A mathematical algorithm that maps data of arbitrary size to a bit string.

options.name: blake2b256
options.summary: blake2b algorithm with a digest size of 256 https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7693#section-4

options.name: blake2b384
options.summary: blake2b algorithm with a digest size of 384 https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7693#section-4

options.name: blake2b512
options.summary: blake2b algorithm with a digest size of 512 https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7693#section-4

options.name: blake3
options.summary: https://github.com/BLAKE3-team/BLAKE3-specs/blob/master/blake3.pdf

options.name: crystalsKyber
options.summary: https://pq-crystals.org/kyber/index.shtml

options.name: crystalsDilithium
options.summary: https://pq-crystals.org/dilithium/index.shtml

options.name: falcon
options.summary: https://falcon-sign.info/falcon.pdf

options.name: md2
options.summary: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/rfc1319/

options.name: md4
options.summary: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1186

options.name: md5
options.summary: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1321

options.name: md6
options.summary: https://people.csail.mit.edu/rivest/pubs/RABCx08.pdf

options.name: other
options.summary: any hashing algorithm that does not exist in this list of entries

options.name: sha1
options.summary: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3174

options.name: sha224
options.summary: secure hashing algorithm with a digest length of 224 https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-ietf-pkix-sha224-01

options.name: sha256
options.summary: secure hashing algorithm with a digest length of 256 https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc4634

options.name: sha3_224
options.summary: sha3 with a digest length of 224 https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/FIPS/NIST.FIPS.202.pdf

options.name: sha3_256
options.summary: sha3 with a digest length of 256 https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/FIPS/NIST.FIPS.202.pdf

options.name: sha3_384
options.summary: sha3 with a digest length of 384 https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/FIPS/NIST.FIPS.202.pdf

options.name: sha3_512
options.summary: sha3 with a digest length of 512 https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/FIPS/NIST.FIPS.202.pdf

options.name: sha384
options.summary: secure hashing algorithm with a digest length of 384 https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc4634

options.name: sha512
options.summary: secure hashing algorithm with a digest length of 512 https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc4634

SpdxDocument.name: SpdxDocument
SpdxDocument.summary: A collection of SPDX Elements that could potentially be serialized.

ElementCollection.name: ElementCollection
ElementCollection.summary: A collection of Elements, not necessarily with unifying context.

NamespaceMap.name: NamespaceMap
NamespaceMap.summary: A mapping between prefixes and namespace partial URIs.

ExternalMap.name: ExternalMap
ExternalMap.summary: A map of Element identifiers that are used within a Document but defined external to that Document.

Artifact.name: Artifact
Artifact.summary: A distinct article or unit within the digital domain.

Bom.name: Bom
Bom.summary:
A container for a grouping of SPDX-3.0 content characterizing details
(provenence, composition, licensing, etc.) about a product.

PositiveIntegerRange.name: PositiveIntegerRange
PositiveIntegerRange.summary: A tuple of two positive integers that define a range.

Bundle.name: Bundle
Bundle.summary: A collection of Elements that have a shared context.

ExternalIdentifierType.name: ExternalIdentifierType
ExternalIdentifierType.summary: Specifies the type of an external identifier.

options.name: cpe22
options.summary: https://cpe.mitre.org/files/cpe-specification_2.2.pdf

options.name: cpe23
options.summary: https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/Legacy/IR/nistir7695.pdf

options.name: cve
options.summary: An identifier for a specific software flaw defined within the official CVE Dictionary and that conforms to the CVE specification as defined by https://csrc.nist.gov/glossary/term/cve_id.

options.name: email
options.summary: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3696#section-3

options.name: gitoid
options.summary: https://www.iana.org/assignments/uri-schemes/prov/gitoid Gitoid stands for [Git Object ID](https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Git-Internals-Git-Objects) and a gitoid of type blob is a unique hash of a binary artifact. A gitoid may represent the software [Artifact ID](https://github.com/omnibor/spec/blob/main/spec/SPEC.md#artifact-id) or the [OmniBOR Identifier](https://github.com/omnibor/spec/blob/main/spec/SPEC.md#omnibor-identifier) for the software artifact's associated [OmniBOR Document](https://github.com/omnibor/spec/blob/main/spec/SPEC.md#omnibor-document); this ambiguity exists because the OmniBOR Document is itself an artifact, and the gitoid of that artifact is its valid identifier. Omnibor is a minimalistic schema to describe software [Artifact Dependency Graphs](https://github.com/omnibor/spec/blob/main/spec/SPEC.md#artifact-dependency-graph-adg). Gitoids calculated on software artifacts (Snippet, File, or Package Elements) should be recorded in the SPDX 3.0 SoftwareArtifact's ContentIdentifier property. Gitoids calculated on the OmniBOR Document (OmniBOR Identifiers) should be recorded in the SPDX 3.0 Element's ExternalIdentifier property.

options.name: other
options.summary: Used when the type doesn't match any of the other options.

options.name: packageUrl
options.summary: https://github.com/package-url/purl-spec

options.name: securityOther
options.summary: Used when there is a security related identifier of unspecified type.

options.name: swhid
options.summary: SoftWare Hash IDentifier, persistent intrinsic identifiers for digital artifacts, such as files, trees (also known as directories or folders), commits, and other objects typically found in version control systems. The syntax of the identifiers is defined in the [SWHID specification](https://www.swhid.org/specification/v1.1/4.Syntax) and they typically look like `swh:1:cnt:94a9ed024d3859793618152ea559a168bbcbb5e2`.

options.name: swid
options.summary: https://www.ietf.org/archive/id/draft-ietf-sacm-coswid-21.html#section-2.3

options.name: urlScheme
options.summary: the scheme used in order to locate a resource https://www.iana.org/assignments/uri-schemes/uri-schemes.xhtml

ExternalRefType.name: ExternalRefType
ExternalRefType.summary: Specifies the type of an external reference.

options.name: altDownloadLocation
options.summary: A reference to an alternative download location.

options.name: altWebPage
options.summary: A reference to an alternative web page.

options.name: binaryArtifact
options.summary: A reference to binary artifacts related to a package.

options.name: bower
options.summary: A reference to a bower package.

options.name: buildMeta
options.summary: A reference build metadata related to a published package.

options.name: buildSystem
options.summary: A reference build system used to create or publish the package.

options.name: certificationReport
options.summary: A reference to a certification report for a package from an accredited/independent body.

options.name: chat
options.summary: A reference to the instant messaging system used by the maintainer for a package.

options.name: componentAnalysisReport
options.summary: A reference to a Software Composition Analysis (SCA) report.

options.name: cwe
options.summary: A reference to a source of software flaw defined within the official CWE Dictionary that conforms to the CWE specification as defined by https://csrc.nist.gov/glossary/term/common_weakness_enumeration.

options.name: documentation
options.summary: A reference to the documentation for a package.

options.name: dynamicAnalysisReport
options.summary: A reference to a dynamic analysis report for a package.

options.name: eolNotice
options.summary: A reference to the End Of Sale (EOS) and/or End Of Life (EOL) information related to a package.

options.name: exportControlAssessment
options.summary: A reference to a export control assessment for a package.

options.name: funding
options.summary: A reference to funding information related to a package.

options.name: issueTracker
options.summary: A reference to the issue tracker for a package.

options.name: license
options.summary: A reference to additional license information related to an artifact.

options.name: mailingList
options.summary: A reference to the mailing list used by the maintainer for a package.

options.name: mavenCentral
options.summary: A reference to a maven repository artifact.

options.name: metrics
options.summary: A reference to metrics related to package such as OpenSSF scorecards.

options.name: npm
options.summary: A reference to an npm package.

options.name: nuget
options.summary: A reference to a nuget package.

options.name: other
options.summary: Used when the type doesn't match any of the other options.

options.name: privacyAssessment
options.summary: A reference to a privacy assessment for a package.

options.name: productMetadata
options.summary: A reference to additional product metadata such as reference within organization's product catalog.

options.name: purchaseOrder
options.summary: A reference to a purchase order for a package.

options.name: qualityAssessmentReport
options.summary: A reference to a quality assessment for a package.

options.name: releaseHistory
options.summary: A reference to a published list of releases for a package.

options.name: releaseNotes
options.summary: A reference to the release notes for a package.

options.name: riskAssessment
options.summary: A reference to a risk assessment for a package.

options.name: runtimeAnalysisReport
options.summary: A reference to a runtime analysis report for a package.

options.name: secureSoftwareAttestation
options.summary: A reference to information assuring that the software is developed using security practices as defined by [NIST SP 800-218 Secure Software Development Framework (SSDF) Version 1.1](https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/218/final) or [CISA Secure Software Development Attestation Form](https://www.cisa.gov/resources-tools/resources/secure-software-development-attestation-form).

options.name: securityAdversaryModel
options.summary: A reference to the security adversary model for a package.

options.name: securityAdvisory
options.summary: A reference to a published security advisory (where advisory as defined per ISO 29147:2018) that may affect one or more elements, e.g., vendor advisories or specific NVD entries.

options.name: securityFix
options.summary: A reference to the patch or source code that fixes a vulnerability.

options.name: securityOther
options.summary: A reference to related security information of unspecified type.

options.name: securityPenTestReport
options.summary: A reference to a [penetration test](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penetration_test) report for a package.

options.name: securityPolicy
options.summary: A reference to instructions for reporting newly discovered security vulnerabilities for a package.

options.name: securityThreatModel
options.summary: A reference the [security threat model](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Threat_model) for a package.

options.name: socialMedia
options.summary: A reference to a social media channel for a package.

options.name: sourceArtifact
options.summary: A reference to an artifact containing the sources for a package.

options.name: staticAnalysisReport
options.summary: A reference to a static analysis report for a package.

options.name: support
options.summary: A reference to the software support channel or other support information for a package.

options.name: vcs
options.summary: A reference to a version control system related to a software artifact.

options.name: vulnerabilityDisclosureReport
options.summary: A reference to a Vulnerability Disclosure Report (VDR) which provides the software supplier's analysis and findings describing the impact (or lack of impact) that reported vulnerabilities have on packages or products in the supplier's SBOM as defined in [NIST SP 800-161](https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/161/r1/final).

options.name: vulnerabilityExploitabilityAssessment
options.summary: A reference to a Vulnerability Exploitability eXchange (VEX) statement which provides information on whether a product is impacted by a specific vulnerability in an included package and, if affected, whether there are actions recommended to remediate. See also [NTIA VEX one-page summary](https://ntia.gov/files/ntia/publications/vex_one-page_summary.pdf).

options.name: ai
options.summary: the element follows the AI profile specification

options.name: build
options.summary: the element follows the Build profile specification

options.name: core
options.summary: the element follows the Core profile specification

options.name: dataset
options.summary: the element follows the Dataset profile specification

options.name: expandedLicensing
options.summary: the element follows the expanded Licensing profile specification

options.name: extension
options.summary: the element follows the Extension profile specification

options.name: security
options.summary: the element follows the Security profile specification

options.name: simpleLicensing
options.summary: the element follows the simple Licensing profile specification

options.name: software
options.summary: the element follows the Software profile specification

options.name: usage
options.summary: the element follows the Usage profile specification

RelationshipCompleteness.name: RelationshipCompleteness
RelationshipCompleteness.summary: Indicates whether a relationship is known to be complete, incomplete, or if no assertion is made with respect to relationship completeness.

options.name: complete
options.summary: The relationship is known to be exhaustive.

options.name: incomplete
options.summary: The relationship is known not to be exhaustive.

options.name: noAssertion
options.summary: No assertion can be made about the completeness of the relationship.

RelationshipType.name: RelationshipType
RelationshipType.summary: Information about the relationship between two Elements.

options.name: affects
options.summary: (Security/VEX) The `from` vulnerability affect each `to` Element

options.name: amendedBy
options.summary: The `from` Element is amended by each `to` Element

options.name: ancestorOf
options.summary: The `from` Element is an ancestor of each `to` Element

options.name: availableFrom
options.summary: The `from` Element is available from the additional supplier described by each `to` Element

options.name: configures
options.summary: The `from` Element is a configuration applied to each `to` Element during a LifecycleScopeType period

options.name: contains
options.summary: The `from` Element contains each `to` Element

options.name: coordinatedBy
options.summary: (Security) The `from` Vulnerability is coordinatedBy the `to` Agent(s) (vendor, researcher, or consumer agent)

options.name: copiedTo
options.summary: The `from` Element has been copied to each `to` Element

options.name: delegatedTo
options.summary: The `from` Agent is delegating an action to the Agent of the `to` Relationship (which must be of type invokedBy) during a LifecycleScopeType. (e.g. the `to` invokedBy Relationship is being done on behalf of `from`)

options.name: dependsOn
options.summary: The `from` Element depends on each `to` Element during a LifecycleScopeType period.

options.name: descendantOf
options.summary: The `from` Element is a descendant of each `to` Element

options.name: describes
options.summary: The `from` Element describes each `to` Element. To denote the root(s) of a tree of elements in a collection, the rootElement property should be used.

options.name: doesNotAffect
options.summary: (Security/VEX) The `from` Vulnerability has no impact on each `to` Element

options.name: expandsTo
options.summary: The `from` archive expands out as an artifact described by each `to` Element

options.name: exploitCreatedBy
options.summary: (Security) The `from` Vulnerability has had an exploit created against it by each `to` Agent

options.name: fixedBy
options.summary: (Security) Designates a `from` Vulnerability has been fixed by the `to` Agent(s)

options.name: fixedIn
options.summary: (Security/VEX) A `from` Vulnerability has been fixed in each of the `to` Element(s)

options.name: foundBy
options.summary: (Security) Designates a `from` Vulnerability was originally discovered by the `to` Agent(s)

options.name: generates
options.summary: The `from` Element generates each `to` Element

options.name: hasAddedFile
options.summary: Every `to` Element is is a file added to the `from` Element (`from` hasAddedFile `to`)

options.name: hasAssessmentFor
options.summary: (Security) Relates a `from` Vulnerability and each `to` Element(s) with a security assessment. To be used with `VulnAssessmentRelationship` types

options.name: hasAssociatedVulnerability
options.summary: (Security) Used to associate a `from` Artifact with each `to` Vulnerability

options.name: hasConcludedLicense
options.summary: The `from` Software Artifact is concluded by the SPDX data creator to be governed by each `to` license

options.name: hasDataFile
options.summary: The `from` Element treats each `to` Element as a data file

options.name: hasDeclaredLicense
options.summary: The `from` Software Artifact was discovered to actually contain each `to` license, for example as detected by use of automated tooling.

options.name: hasDeletedFile
options.summary: Every `to` Element is a file deleted from the `from` Element (`from` hasDeletedFile `to`)

options.name: hasDependencyManifest
options.summary: The `from` Element has manifest files that contain dependency information in each `to` Element

options.name: hasDistributionArtifact
options.summary: The `from` Element is distributed as an artifact in each Element `to`, (e.g. an RPM or archive file)

options.name: hasDocumentation
options.summary: The `from` Element is documented by each `to` Element

options.name: hasDynamicLink
options.summary: The `from` Element dynamically links in each `to` Element, during a LifecycleScopeType period.

options.name: hasEvidence
options.summary: (Dataset) Every `to` Element is considered as evidence for the `from` Element (`from` hasEvidence `to`)

options.name: hasExample
options.summary: Every `to` Element is an example for the `from` Element (`from` hasExample `to`)

options.name: hasHost
options.summary: The `from` Build was run on the `to` Element during a LifecycleScopeType period (e.g. The host that the build runs on)

options.name: hasInputs
options.summary: The `from` Build has each `to` Elements as an input during a LifecycleScopeType period.

options.name: hasMetadata
options.summary: Every `to` Element is metadata about the `from` Element (`from` hasMetadata `to`)

options.name: hasOptionalComponent
options.summary: Every `to` Element is an optional component of the `from` Element (`from` hasOptionalComponent` `to`)

options.name: hasOptionalDependency
options.summary: The `from` Element optionally depends on each `to` Element during a LifecycleScopeType period

options.name: hasOutputs
options.summary: The `from` Build element generates each `to` Element as an output during a LifecycleScopeType period.

options.name: hasPrerequsite
options.summary: The `from` Element has a prerequsite on each `to` Element, during a LifecycleScopeType period

options.name: hasProvidedDependency
options.summary: The `from` Element has a dependency on each `to` Element, but dependency is not in the distributed artifact, but assumed to be provided, during a LifecycleScopeType period

options.name: hasRequirement
options.summary: The `from` Element has a requirement on each `to` Element, during a LifecycleScopeType period

options.name: hasSpecification
options.summary: Every `to` Element is a specification for the `from` Element (`from` hasSpecification `to`), during a LifecycleScopeType period

options.name: hasStaticLink
options.summary: The `from` Element statically links in each `to` Element, during a LifecycleScopeType period

options.name: hasTest
options.summary: Every `to` Element is a test artifact for the `from` Element (`from` hasTest `to`), during a LifecycleScopeType period

options.name: hasTestCase
options.summary: Every `to` Element is a test case for the `from` Element (`from` hasTestCase `to`)

options.name: hasVariant
options.summary: Every `to` Element is a variant the `from` Element (`from` hasVariant `to`)

options.name: invokedBy
options.summary: The `from` Element was invoked by the `to` Agent during a LifecycleScopeType period (for example, a Build element that describes a build step)

options.name: modifiedBy
options.summary: The `from` Element is modified by each `to` Element

options.name: other
options.summary: Every `to` Element is related to the `from` Element where the relationship type is not described by any of the SPDX relationhip types (this relationship is directionless)

options.name: packagedBy
options.summary: Every `to` Element is a packaged instance of the `from` Element (`from` packagedBy `to`)

options.name: patchedBy
options.summary: Every `to` Element is a patch for the `from` Element (`from` patchedBy `to`)

options.name: publishedBy
options.summary: (Security) Designates a `from` Vulnerability was made available for public use or reference by each `to` Agent

options.name: reportedBy
options.summary: (Security) Designates a `from` Vulnerability was first reported to a project, vendor, or tracking database for formal identification by each `to` Agent

options.name: republishedBy
options.summary: (Security) Designates a `from` Vulnerability's details were tracked, aggregated, and/or enriched to improve context (i.e. NVD) by a `to` Agent(s)

options.name: serializedInArtifact
options.summary: The `from` SPDXDocument can be found in a serialized form in each `to` Artifact

options.name: testedOn
options.summary: (AI, Dataset) The `from` Element has been tested on the `to` Element

options.name: trainedOn
options.summary: (AI, Dataset) The `from` Element has been trained by the `to` Element(s)

options.name: underInvestigationFor
options.summary: (Security/VEX) The `from` Vulnerability impact is being investigated for each `to` Element

options.name: usesTool
options.summary: The `from` Element uses each `to` Element as a tool during a LifecycleScopeType period.

SupportType.name: SupportType
SupportType.summary: Indicates the type of support that is associated with an artifact.

options.name: deployed
options.summary: in addition to being supported by the supplier, the software is known to have been deployed and is in use.  For a software as a service provider, this implies the software is now available as a service.

options.name: development
options.summary: the artifact is in active development and is not considered ready for formal support from the supplier.

options.name: endOfSupport
options.summary: there is a defined end of support for the artifact from the supplier.  This may also be referred to as end of life. There is a validUntilDate that can be used to signal when support ends for the artifact.

options.name: limitedSupport
options.summary: the artifact has been released, and there is limited support available from the supplier. There is a validUntilDate that can provide additional information about the duration of support.

options.name: noAssertion
options.summary: no assertion about the type of support is made.   This is considered the default if no other support type is used.

options.name: noSupport
options.summary: there is no support for the artifact from the supplier, consumer assumes any support obligations.

options.name: support
options.summary: the artifact has been released, and is supported from the supplier.   There is a validUntilDate that can provide additional information about the duration of support.

Tool.name: Tool
Tool.summary: An element of hardware and/or software utilized to carry out a particular function.

CreationInfo.name: CreationInfo
CreationInfo.summary: Provides information about the creation of the Element.

ExternalIdentifier.name: ExternalIdentifier
ExternalIdentifier.summary: A reference to a resource identifier defined outside the scope of SPDX-3.0 content that uniquely identifies an Element.

ExternalRef.name: ExternalRef
ExternalRef.summary: A reference to a resource outside the scope of SPDX-3.0 content related to an Element.

Build.name: Build
Build.summary: Class that describes a build instance of software/artifacts.

AnyLicenseInfo.name: AnyLicenseInfo
AnyLicenseInfo.summary:
Abstract class representing a license combination consisting of one or more
licenses (optionally including additional text), which may be combined
according to the SPDX license expression syntax.

LicenseExpression.name: LicenseExpression
LicenseExpression.summary: An SPDX Element containing an SPDX license expression string.

SimpleLicensingText.name: SimpleLicensingText
SimpleLicensingText.summary: A license or addition that is not listed on the SPDX License List.

DatasetPackage.name: DatasetPackage
DatasetPackage.summary: Specifies a data package and its associated information.

options.name: audio
options.summary: data is audio based, such as a collection of music from the 80s.

options.name: categorical
options.summary: data that is classified into a discrete number of categories, such as the eye color of a population of people.

options.name: graph
options.summary: data is in the form of a graph where entries are somehow related to each other through edges, such a social network of friends.

options.name: image
options.summary: data is a collection of images such as pictures of animals.

options.name: numeric
options.summary: data consists only of numeric entries.

options.name: sensor
options.summary: data is recorded from a physical sensor, such as a thermometer reading or biometric device.

options.name: structured
options.summary: data is stored in tabular format or retrieved from a relational database.

options.name: syntactic
options.summary: data describes the syntax or semantics of a language or text, such as a parse tree used for natural language processing.

options.name: text
options.summary: data consists of unstructured text, such as a book, Wikipedia article (without images), or transcript.

options.name: timeseries
options.summary: data is recorded in an ordered sequence of timestamped entries, such as the price of a stock over the course of a day.

options.name: timestamp
options.summary: data is recorded with a timestamp for each entry, but not necessarily ordered or at specific intervals, such as when a taxi ride starts and ends.

options.name: video
options.summary: data is video based, such as a collection of movie clips featuring Tom Hanks.

options.name: other
options.summary: data is of a type not included in this list.

options.name: noAssertion
options.summary: data type is not known.

options.name: directDownload
options.summary: the dataset is publicly available and can be downloaded directly.

options.name: scrapingScript
options.summary: the dataset provider is not making available the underlying data and the dataset must be reassembled, typically using the provided script for scraping the data.

options.name: query
options.summary: the dataset is publicly available, but not all at once, and can only be accessed through queries which return parts of the dataset.

options.name: clickthrough
options.summary: the dataset is not publicly available and can only be accessed after affirmatively accepting terms on a clickthrough webpage.

options.name: registration
options.summary: the dataset is not publicly available and an email registration is required before accessing the dataset, although without an affirmative acceptance of terms.

options.name: red
options.summary: Data points in the dataset are highly confidential and can only be shared with named recipients.

options.name: amber
options.summary: Data points in the dataset can be shared only with specific organizations and their clients on a need to know basis.

options.name: green
options.summary: Dataset can be shared within a community of peers and partners.

options.name: clear
options.summary: Dataset may be distributed freely, without restriction.

ConjunctiveLicenseSet.name: ConjunctiveLicenseSet
ConjunctiveLicenseSet.summary:
Portion of an AnyLicenseInfo representing a set of licensing information
where all elements apply.

CustomLicense.name: CustomLicense
CustomLicense.summary: A license that is not listed on the SPDX License List.

License.name: License
License.summary: Abstract class for the portion of an AnyLicenseInfo representing a license.

CustomLicenseAddition.name: CustomLicenseAddition
CustomLicenseAddition.summary: A license addition that is not listed on the SPDX Exceptions List.

LicenseAddition.name: LicenseAddition
LicenseAddition.summary:
Abstract class for additional text intended to be added to a License, but
which is not itself a standalone License.

DisjunctiveLicenseSet.name: DisjunctiveLicenseSet
DisjunctiveLicenseSet.summary:
Portion of an AnyLicenseInfo representing a set of licensing information
where only one of the elements applies.

ListedLicense.name: ListedLicense
ListedLicense.summary: A license that is listed on the SPDX License List.

ListedLicenseException.name: ListedLicenseException
ListedLicenseException.summary: A license exception that is listed on the SPDX Exceptions list.

IndividualLicensingInfo.name: IndividualLicensingInfo
IndividualLicensingInfo.summary: A concrete subclass of AnyLicenseInfo used by Individuals in the ExpandedLicensing profile.

OrLaterOperator.name: OrLaterOperator
OrLaterOperator.summary:
Portion of an AnyLicenseInfo representing this version, or any later version,
of the indicated License.

ExtendableLicense.name: ExtendableLicense
ExtendableLicense.summary: Abstract class representing a License or an OrLaterOperator.

WithAdditionOperator.name: WithAdditionOperator
WithAdditionOperator.summary:
Portion of an AnyLicenseInfo representing a License which has additional
text applied to it.

CdxPropertiesExtension.name: CdxPropertiesExtension
CdxPropertiesExtension.summary: A type of extension consisting of a list of name value pairs.

Extension.name: Extension
Extension.summary: A characterization of some aspect of an Element that is associated with the Element in a generalized fashion.

CdxPropertyEntry.name: CdxPropertyEntry
CdxPropertyEntry.summary: A property name with an associated value.

CvssV2VulnAssessmentRelationship.name: CvssV2VulnAssessmentRelationship
CvssV2VulnAssessmentRelationship.summary: Provides a CVSS version 2.0 assessment for a vulnerability.

VulnAssessmentRelationship.name: VulnAssessmentRelationship
VulnAssessmentRelationship.summary: Abstract ancestor class for all vulnerability assessments

CvssV3VulnAssessmentRelationship.name: CvssV3VulnAssessmentRelationship
CvssV3VulnAssessmentRelationship.summary: Provides a CVSS version 3 assessment for a vulnerability.

CvssSeverityType.name: CvssSeverityType
CvssSeverityType.summary: Specifies the CVSS base, temporal, threat, or environmental severity type.

options.name: critical
options.summary: When a CVSS score is between 9.0 - 10.0

options.name: high
options.summary: When a CVSS score is between 7.0 - 8.9

options.name: medium
options.summary: When a CVSS score is between 4 - 6.9

options.name: low
options.summary: When a CVSS score is between 0 - 3.9

options.name: none
options.summary: When a CVSS score is 0

CvssV4VulnAssessmentRelationship.name: CvssV4VulnAssessmentRelationship
CvssV4VulnAssessmentRelationship.summary: Provides a CVSS version 4 assessment for a vulnerability.

EpssVulnAssessmentRelationship.name: EpssVulnAssessmentRelationship
EpssVulnAssessmentRelationship.summary: Provides an EPSS assessment for a vulnerability.

ExploitCatalogVulnAssessmentRelationship.name: ExploitCatalogVulnAssessmentRelationship
ExploitCatalogVulnAssessmentRelationship.summary: Provides an exploit assessment of a vulnerability.

options.name: kev
options.summary: CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerability (KEV) Catalog

options.name: other
options.summary: Other exploit catalogs

SsvcVulnAssessmentRelationship.name: SsvcVulnAssessmentRelationship
SsvcVulnAssessmentRelationship.summary: Provides an SSVC assessment for a vulnerability.

options.name: act
options.summary: The vulnerability requires attention from the organization's internal, supervisory-level and leadership-level individuals. Necessary actions include requesting assistance or information about the vulnerability, as well as publishing a notification either internally and/or externally. Typically, internal groups would meet to determine the overall response and then execute agreed upon actions. CISA recommends remediating Act vulnerabilities as soon as possible.

options.name: attend
options.summary: The vulnerability requires attention from the organization's internal, supervisory-level individuals. Necessary actions include requesting assistance or information about the vulnerability, and may involve publishing a notification either internally and/or externally. CISA recommends remediating Attend vulnerabilities sooner than standard update timelines.

options.name: track
options.summary: The vulnerability does not require action at this time. The organization would continue to track the vulnerability and reassess it if new information becomes available. CISA recommends remediating Track vulnerabilities within standard update timelines.

options.name: trackStar
options.summary: (Track* in the SSVC spec) The vulnerability contains specific characteristics that may require closer monitoring for changes. CISA recommends remediating Track* vulnerabilities within standard update timelines.

VexAffectedVulnAssessmentRelationship.name: VexAffectedVulnAssessmentRelationship
VexAffectedVulnAssessmentRelationship.summary:
Connects a vulnerability and an element designating the element as a product
affected by the vulnerability.

VexVulnAssessmentRelationship.name: VexVulnAssessmentRelationship
VexVulnAssessmentRelationship.summary: Asbtract ancestor class for all VEX relationships

VexFixedVulnAssessmentRelationship.name: VexFixedVulnAssessmentRelationship
VexFixedVulnAssessmentRelationship.summary:
Links a vulnerability and elements representing products (in the VEX sense) where
a fix has been applied and are no longer affected.

VexNotAffectedVulnAssessmentRelationship.name: VexNotAffectedVulnAssessmentRelationship
VexNotAffectedVulnAssessmentRelationship.summary:
Links a vulnerability and one or more elements designating the latter as products
not affected by the vulnerability.

options.name: componentNotPresent
options.summary: The software is not affected because the vulnerable component is not in the product.

options.name: vulnerableCodeNotPresent
options.summary: The product is not affected because the code underlying the vulnerability is not present in the product.

options.name: vulnerableCodeCannotBeControlledByAdversary
options.summary: The vulnerable component is present, and the component contains the vulnerable code. However, vulnerable code is used in such a way that an attacker cannot mount any anticipated attack.

options.name: vulnerableCodeNotInExecutePath
options.summary: The affected code is not reachable through the execution of the code, including non-anticipated states of the product.

options.name: inlineMitigationsAlreadyExist
options.summary: Built-in inline controls or mitigations prevent an adversary from leveraging the vulnerability.

VexUnderInvestigationVulnAssessmentRelat.name: VexUnderInvestigationVulnAssessmentRelationship
VexUnderInvestigationVulnAssessmentRelat.summary:
Designates elements as products where the impact of a vulnerability is being
investigated.

Vulnerability.name: Vulnerability
Vulnerability.summary: Specifies a vulnerability and its associated information.
